item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeNew Mexico became the first state to elect all women of color to its House delegation with the three women...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeNew Mexico became the first state to elect all women of color to its House delegation with the three women announced as winning their districts by early Wednesday morning.

thehill.com

New Mexico becomes first state to elect all women of color to House delegation

New Mexico became the first state to elect all women of color to its House delegation with the three women announced as winning their districts by early Wednesday morning.New Mexico became the first state to elect all women of color to its House delegation with the three women announced as winning their districts by early Wednesday morning.

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeTammy Bellofatto shared a photo to the group: Taskforce Denver Homeless.If you are looking for a place to...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeTammy Bellofatto shared a photo to the group: Taskforce Denver Homeless.

If you are looking for a place to donate toys

Travis Singhaus updated his cover photo.

For the last 8 years Impact has been collecting toys for families in need at homeless shelters around the Metro area. Together let's make sure that every child ...gets a visit from Santa this year!

Now more than ever these kids deserve something positive in their lives!

To find a drop off location near you go to www.impactlocally.org/toy-drive

Due to Covid-19 precautions we are asking that the toys be new and unwrappped.

THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR BEING AMAZING!

See More

item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeJen Greenfield

FYI: The NAACP is working with @Lyft to offer free, safe rides to polling stations and registered drop box locations across the U.S from now through Election Day. #RideToVote

Lyft Code: NAACPVOTE2020

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeGovernor Jared PolisIt’s Election Day! If you didn’t get a ballot, lost it, or haven’t registered then...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeGovernor Jared Polis

It’s Election Day! If you didn’t get a ballot, lost it, or haven’t registered then you can vote TODAY in person, polls close at 7:00 PM.

If you’re voting by mail ballot, make sure to return it by 7:00 PM.

You can find a drop box or in-person voting center near you at GoVoteColorado.gov

See the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates
item.author: North Denver for Social Justice

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeAmplifierWe are so excited to share this NEW ARTWORK created by Holy Moly UK to uplift voting in the upcoming...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeAmplifier

We are so excited to share this NEW ARTWORK created by Holy Moly UK to uplift voting in the upcoming election. Download the artwork for free at amplifier.org 🔊🔊...🔊

From Carl about the piece, ”My design aims to encourage voting in the upcoming US election. I wanted the message to be vibrant, to sing with colour and positivity for the future. There is still hope, but we need to make very bold decisions regarding the environment. The US needs a leader that is more focused on global issues than their own twitter feed! US friends if you are reading this please vote, it is so so important!”

See More

North Denver for Social JusticeDenver’s top officials will launch a police command post in preparation for potential post-election unrest — the first time the city has taken such measures around an election.

denverpost.com

For first time, Denver enacts police command center for potential election unrest

Denver’s top officials will launch a police command post in preparation for potential post-election unrest — the first time the city has taken such measures around an election.Denver’s top officials will launch a police command post in preparation for potential post-election unrest — the first time the city has taken such measures around an election.

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeGovernor Jared PolisToday, in close consultation with legislative leadership, I am ordering one-time $375...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeGovernor Jared Polis

Today, in close consultation with legislative leadership, I am ordering one-time $375 stimulus payments to 435,000 qualifying Coloradans whose lives and jobs ha...ve been hurt due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

I've taken this action because many Coloradans can’t afford to wait while Washington D.C. continues to negotiate a relief package. This will provide additional direct cash support for hardworking Coloradans to further stimulate the economy.

We're thankful to all the members of the GA who joined us in this effort to get direct payments to Coloradans including Senator Leroy Garcia, KC Becker for Colorado State House, Garnett for Colorado, Senator Steve Fenberg, Representative Daneya Esgar, HD 46, Senator Dominick Moreno, Representative Julie McCluskie, Rachel Zenzinger for Colorado, State Representative Shannon Bird, Jeff Bridges for Colorado, Representative Kyle Mullica, House District 34, Kerry Donovan

READ MORE: https://www.colorado.gov/…/3311-governor-polis-legislative-…

See More

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out LoudSNOW is coming...Winter Gear Needed on FRIDAY Call out for winter gear!! It is gonna...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out Loud

SNOW is coming...Winter Gear Needed on FRIDAY

Call out for winter gear!! It is gonna be freezing cold and snow on Sunday and Monday. With all the sweeps lately ...many people have lost their gear and have nothing. Proper gear can be a matter of life and death.
Please donate the following to our office ON FRIDAY (10/23) anytime between 9am and 5pm. We will not be in the office on Saturday so please bring it by Friday so it can get to people in need.
(Or give it directly to someone in need.)
-Tents ($25)*
-Tarps ($6)
-Sleeping Bags ($30)
-Blankets ($20)
-Handwarmers ($6)
-Good gloves ($15)

*All prices listed are average price at Walmart. Also you can get these at a thrift store for cheep.

(We do not have storage capacity for clothes, so please only bring winter gear...not lots of clothes - other places will take clothes).

Bring items to the DHOL office (2260 California St Denver CO) THIS Friday 9am to 5pm
Feel free to call us at 720-940-5291
Or give items directly to people on the streets who need these things

Living without a house in the winter requires this protection. Your gifts of gear save people's lives.

Contact:
info@denverhomelessoutloud.org
720-940-5291

See More
item.author: North Denver for Social Justice

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out LoudCity STEALS Port-a-potties from Houseless Encampments!@#$ We have just learned...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Homeless Out Loud

City STEALS Port-a-potties from Houseless Encampments!@#$

We have just learned that the City, under Denver Department of Public Health and Environment (DDPHE)..., is actively having the port-a-potties we have placed at encampments, where people without housing live, removed. They have done this multiple times involving multiple units. They also have orders placed to move the remaining units, without notifying us.

These are the very units you as a community, donated money for though a fundraiser we ran to support the cost of these units through the rest of 2020!!!

They are doing this in spite of CDC guidance, which asks cities to leave encampments in place to help prevent the spread of Covid and to provide port-a-potties to all encampments. Instead the city continually puts the rest of the city at risk by moving these encampments from place to place and now stealing the port-a-potties we put there!@#

They claim these units are unsanitary. Have you seen the city sponsored equivalents? They are in far worse sanitary condition.

Contact DDPHE Matt Wilmes - matthew.wilmes@denvergov.org or 720-865-6880

1) Demand that DDPHE cease this theft of port-a-potties WE have paid for.

2) Contact your Council person with the same demand.

3) Ask for a written response back.

See More
item.author: North Denver for Social Justice

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Elections¿Aún necesita una boleta? ¿Cometió un error? ¡No se preocupe! Use nuestro nuevo servicio...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeDenver Elections

¿Aún necesita una boleta? ¿Cometió un error? ¡No se preocupe! Use nuestro nuevo servicio de entrega de boletas en la acera. Es fácil: simplemente asegúrese que... su registro para votar este actualizado, complete la solicitud en línea para ordenar su boleta, y elija la ubicación y el día para recoger su boleta. Visite DenverVota.org para más información.

See MoreSee the latest updates on the 2020 US Election. See Election Updates
